main event: On August 14, 1960, an observer reported seeing a small object appearing to be a balloon-like shape that was stationary about 2 feet off the ground and drifting northeast at approximately 500 feet in the air.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 10 minutes., The object was described as approximately 1.5 to 2 inches long., Multiple conclusions state that it was probably a balloon, but also considered astronomical., The observer noted the object moved or maneuvered rather than flying steadily., The report contained testimonies from other witnesses, but their details were not specified.
witness description: Observed the object from the ground
